content.raw:
I encounter the error in step 4 on Ubuntu 16.04.1.


```
#!c++

~$ sudo apt-get install srcsim
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have
requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 srcsim : Depends: robonet-tools but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: val-gazebo but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: val-controller-manager-rtt but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: shared-memory-transport but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: ros-indigo-ihmc-valkyrie-ros but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: ros-indigo-gazebo7-plugins but it is not installable
          Depends: ros-indigo-gazebo7-ros but it is not installable
          Depends: ros-indigo-message-runtime but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: ros-indigo-xacro but it is not going to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
~$ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS
Release:	16.04
Codename:	xenial
```
After tracing to first failed depends, ** robonet-tools**, the reason is this depends on **libboost-system1.54.0**, however, it should be **libboost-system1.58.0** on Ubuntu 16.04.1.

```
#!


~$ sudo apt-get install libboost-system1.54.0
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
Package libboost-system1.54.0 is not available, but is referred to by another package.
This may mean that the package is missing, has been obsoleted, or
is only available from another source

E: Package 'libboost-system1.54.0' has no installation candidate
```


Refer to issue #7, the workaround is shifted to Ubuntu 14.

So, may I confirm that the working Ubuntu version is only on Ubuntu 14?
content.html:
I encounter the error in step 4 on Ubuntu 16.04.1.

~$ sudo apt-get install srcsim
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have
requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 srcsim : Depends: robonet-tools but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: val-gazebo but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: val-controller-manager-rtt but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: shared-memory-transport but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: ros-indigo-ihmc-valkyrie-ros but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: ros-indigo-gazebo7-plugins but it is not installable
          Depends: ros-indigo-gazebo7-ros but it is not installable
          Depends: ros-indigo-message-runtime but it is not going to be installed
          Depends: ros-indigo-xacro but it is not going to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
~$ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS
Release:    16.04
Codename:   xenial

After tracing to first failed depends, robonet-tools, the reason is this depends on libboost-system1.54.0, however, it should be libboost-system1.58.0 on Ubuntu 16.04.1.

~$ sudo apt-get install libboost-system1.54.0
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
Package libboost-system1.54.0 is not available, but is referred to by another package.
This may mean that the package is missing, has been obsoleted, or
is only available from another source

E: Package 'libboost-system1.54.0' has no installation candidate

Refer to issue #7, the workaround is shifted to Ubuntu 14.

So, may I confirm that the working Ubuntu version is only on Ubuntu 14?
